docs.snippet: The Lake Erie Monsters, the top farm team for the N.H.L.’s Columbus Blue Jackets, completed a sweep of the Hershey Bears to win the American Hockey League title on Saturday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Lake Erie Monsters, the top farm team for the N.H.L.’s Columbus Blue Jackets, completed a sweep of the Hershey Bears to win the American Hockey League title on Saturday night.
docs.abstract: Cleveland’s minor-league hockey team Lake Erie Monsters defeat Hershey Bears, Washington Capitals farm team, 1-0, to win American Hockey League’s Calder Cup finals.

headline.main: Cleveland Realizes a Championship After All, Thanks to the Monsters
headline.print_headline: Cleveland Realizes a Title After All

docs.snippet: In an hourslong procession that wove 20 miles through Louisville, Ky., spectators lined up 10 deep to honor Muhammad Ali....
docs.lead_paragraph: In an hourslong procession that wove 20 miles through Louisville, Ky., spectators lined up 10 deep to honor Muhammad Ali.
docs.abstract: Tens of thousands of people line streets of Louisville, Ky, to cheer funeral procession for legendary heavyweight boxing champion Muhammad Ali.

headline.main: Through the Streets of Muhammad Ali’s Childhood Home, a Final Send-Off
headline.print_headline: Through the Streets of His Childhood Home, a Final Send-Off for a Hero

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and JIM DWYER

docs.snippet: Secretary General Kofi Annan presented Muhammad Ali with the Messenger of Peace honor....
docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary General Kofi Annan presented Muhammad Ali with the Messenger of Peace honor.
docs.abstract: Reprint of article that appeared in The New York Times on September 16, 1998, describing United Nations ceremony at which Muhammad Ali is awarded honor of Messenger of Peace.

headline.main: Honor at the United Nations Recognizes the International Reach of a Legendary Figure
headline.print_headline: Honor at the United Nations Recognizes the International Reach of a Legendary Figure

docs.snippet: In countries like Slovakia and Hungary, vigilante groups are portraying a menacing incursion of asylum seekers to build support for their xenophobic agendas....
docs.lead_paragraph: In countries like Slovakia and Hungary, vigilante groups are portraying a menacing incursion of asylum seekers to build support for their xenophobic agendas.
docs.abstract: Vigilante groups in Slovakia, Hungary and Bulgaria are patrolling borders, streets and other public areas to defend against what they see as menacing incursion of asylum seekers, many of them Muslims from Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and other poor, war-torn nations; authorities are worried about continuing presence of such groups even as flow of refugees through many of these countries has all but stopped.

headline.main: Vigilantes Patrol Parts of Europe Where Few Migrants Set Foot
headline.print_headline: Vigilantes Patrol Where Few Migrants Set Foot

docs.snippet: Lovable clown to an evolving young man to sociopolitical spokesman, Ali, at 22, is ever elusive....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lovable clown to an evolving young man to sociopolitical spokesman, Ali, at 22, is ever elusive.
docs.abstract: Reprint of article that originally appeared in The New York Times on October 25, 1964, describing how Muhammad Ali changed in eight months after becoming heavyweight champion, and his preparation for upcoming rematch against Sonny Liston to defend championship.

headline.main: Muhammad Ali Grew Into Many Roles

docs.snippet: Cleveland wonders whether it should fight to maintain the modicum of integration it has achieved, or accept the federal government’s more vigorous efforts to desegregate....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cleveland wonders whether it should fight to maintain the modicum of integration it has achieved, or accept the federal government’s more vigorous efforts to desegregate.
docs.abstract: Cleveland, Miss, High School Board must decide whether to appeal federal court ruling that school district, which is about 45 percent black and 47 percent white, must desegregate and consolidate with virtually all-black East Side High; many African-Americans are optimistic that ruling will erase what is left of old racial divisions, while many whites fear it will prompt white families to send their children to private schools or even leave city altogether.

headline.main: In Mississippi Town, Some Fear School Desegregation Ruling May Backfire
headline.print_headline: Mississippi Town Is Relic of Segregated School Era
